text:
We recently implemented a way in data query dynamic pages where we separate the pages for listing page and dynamic page. Now we can have a separate content page with the slug ending `[:dynamic-slug]`  and since this is a separate content page, you can edit in the editor as if its a regular page if you want to add some static modules.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages#create-dynamic-pages-using-query-data>

<@U6W3H6YN8> <@U024L8W0MB6> Correct me if I am wrong here.
Not sure if `[:dynamic-slug]`  works for HubDB / CRM dynamic pages as we just tried implementing that first for data query dynamic pages.

Correct, using data query dynamic pages and following the docs you linked will let you set up dynamic pages that can be modified using the content editor, as the dynamic portion is just a module in the page.

If you check out linked example at <https://github.com/HubSpot/recruiting-agency-graphql-theme>, the editor the details page (dynamic pages as you called them) looks like this, where you can add/edit static modules and even play with the layout/content/ordering of the dynamic portions of the page. Still something to be desired from an editing experience, but might be better than what you have today.

If you want to talk more about this idea, feel free to book me here.
